column4: hello, i have a problem I cannot send email from my computer, using the account on my mail server
on server i use ubuntu server  + postfix
check tail -f /var/log/mail.log  while trying to send
i checked and there is no line of smtp
when you installed postfix did you set it 'local only'?
is your fqdn set right in main.cf i think it is
you're probably aware but a mailserver is tricky, check this out: http://www.postfix.org/documentation.html
i am connecting succesfullu with telnet to from localhost on port 25
how do I change the fqdn for smtp?
for a start change mynetworks, but thats the tip of the iceberg
your wan port 25 is closed but until you are secure, keep it closed but you can test it that way ;p
thanks for advice but I don;t know where to start from
running a mailserver open to the net is asking for trouble. you need to study postfix
now i can connect from the same network with telnet on port 25
